thread.title: Family of Alton Sterling fear 'an almighty cover-up' | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Family of Alton Sterling fear 'an almighty cover-up' | Daily Mail Online

author: Shekhar Bhatia In Baton Rouge
title: Family of Alton Sterling fear 'an almighty cover-up' | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad EXCLUSIVE: Family of police shooting victim Alton Sterling fear 'an almighty cover-up' as the probe into his death comes to a close and people are warned to keep protests 'peaceful' Alton Sterling was shot last July by two police officers and his dying moments were caught on cell phone video which led to the officers suspension Protests which began in Baton Rouge where the killing happened spread across the U.S. and culminated with five Dallas police officers being murdered A fortnight after, three police officers were shot dead in Baton Rouge and both the Baton Rouge and Dallas police murderers were also killed Baton Rouge District Attorney Hillar Moore said this week that the federal inquiry into Sterling's death was close to completion - results due in a month or two Moore's remarks that protests should be 'peaceful' have been taken by Sterling's family to mean the officers may be cleared of any criminal conduct Andricka Williams, the mother of Sterling's five children, said: 'I believe he was murdered and I want justice and nothing less than that' Published: 21:07 GMT, 10 February 2017 | Updated: 23:52 GMT, 10 February 2017 29 shares
